I made my own postcard for a grr-r-eat occasion.

I was headed to Tiger GA (you can guess why I needed to visit that place) and on the way there, I thought, well I will want to mail a postcard home to me and get the "TIGER GA" postmark.  But wait a second, I didn't have any postcards with me, much less any with tigers.

So, the lightbulb went off in my head when I was in an antique/junk shop on the way there and spotted piles and piles of National Geographic magazines in the back.  "I'll bet some have got gr-r-reat pictures of tigers over the years.  I can make a postcard with that".  Didn't take long to find a couple Tigerrific magazines, and after buying them for not much more than what a postcard normally costs, I clipped out the pictures I wanted, glued them on a piece of cardboard and I had my tigerrific postcard, ready to get the Tiger GA postmark.

When I get to Tiger GA, sure enough there's the post office on the main street.  One of the smaller post offices I've ever seen.  I ask the lady, who was about to sell me an ordinary stamp, if they didn't have anything more special.  Well, with my shirt, you'd think she would have offered me the "Year of the Tiger" Stamps (this was 2010) but I had to ask for them.  After getting the tigerrific postmark, I mailed the card home, which got there a day or two later after I got home.
